author: Yaman Agarwal

ingredients.quantity: 2 tbsp + as required to shallow fry veggies

ingredients.ingredient: Split Bengal Gram / Chana Dal- 1/2 tsp
Split Skinless Black Gram / Dhuli Urad Dal- 1/2 tsp

recipeNotes:
Make sure you don't burn the makhane.
And a tsp. of ghee is literally a tsp., not more than that.
I added no salt, you could add some sendha namak, but this works great too without any salt.
title: Phool Makhane | Roasted Lotus Seeds/Fox Nuts for Navratri | Vrat ka khana

steps.text: Heat up the ghee. Only a tsp.
Add the phool makhane and stir them avoiding any burns.
It is going to take 5-7 minutes in medium flame and makhane will be ready. Crunchy and shiny!

content:
Fasting is an important part of our lives. It not only cleanses us from the inside but also maintains a spiritual surrounding around us. But, as a kid to me what fantasized about being on a vrat/fast was having "Phool makhane" :D

If you worry where the hell are you going to find phool makhane in the market, there are groceries which do stock them. Different names in different regions. Makhane is the common one:)

This is something which is a must when you are fasting. And, during Navratri it is always better to stock the supplies for all the days cause you never know what snack you would like (this one is going to be a savior for all days)

Just two ingredients, and makhane are ready :)


I hope you liked it!
